2021-06-27T14:47:35Z: And we'll see you again next week for the Austrian Grand Prix at...the same place! Enjoy the rest of the day.

2021-06-27T14:29:09Z: Norris finished fifth - a lap down, ahead of Sainz, Leclerc, Stroll, Alonso and Tsunoda claiming the final point of the day.
2021-06-27T14:28:41Z: Perez was right on Bottas' tail, but just ran out of laps to claim third!
2021-06-27T14:28:04Z: Hamilton finds a 1m07.058s to snatch the fastest lap!
2021-06-27T14:27:36Z: Verstappen wins the Styrian Grand Prix at an absolute canter!
2021-06-27T14:27:03Z: It's the final lap, will Hamilton grab that final point?
2021-06-27T14:25:54Z: Hamilton comes in to stop for the soft tyre! Here's a bid for the fastest lap.
2021-06-27T14:23:29Z: It all works out well for Raikkonen as he takes the opportunity to go around the outside of Vettel at Turn 4 to move up to 11th place with three laps to go.
2021-06-27T14:24:42Z: Verstappen pulled out a 1m08.017s from nowhere, finding lots more life in his tyres. His lead is now a massive 17s.
2021-06-27T14:22:19Z: Ricciardo, still in P13, is within DRS range of Raikkonen but the problem the McLaren driver has is the Finn also has DRS following Vettel. Worse is to come, as Ricciardo has to obey blue flags to let Bottas lap him.
2021-06-27T14:22:44Z: The Mercedes duo are about a second a lap slower than the Red Bulls at this stage of the race - it won't be a very happy second and third at this rate.
2021-06-27T14:21:01Z: Sainz unlaps himself from Hamilton now, which means he can continue his charge on Norris.
2021-06-27T14:19:20Z: Perez is less than 10s behind Bottas now, but it looks like he's running out of time to catch the Mercedes driver.
2021-06-27T14:16:57Z: Leclerc's overtaking masterclass looks over for today given the 14-second gap to Sainz ahead of him. Further back, Ricciardo is up to P13 having got by Ocon and Giovinazzi.
2021-06-27T14:16:52Z: Sainz's progress on Norris has stalled out a little, and is around 7.5s behind, as he's behind Hamilton having been lapped.
2021-06-27T14:13:58Z: Clearly bored of overtaking rivals at Turn 4, Leclerc opts for a dive up the inside at Turn 3 on Stroll to move up to seventh place. After that clumsy first lap Leclerc has been very impressive today.
2021-06-27T14:14:49Z: The forecast suggests Perez will be on Bottas' tail in seven laps, although it'll probably be longer given traffic and degradation. Regardless, the Red Bull driver is catching him quickly.
2021-06-27T14:12:38Z: Perez bags the fastest lap, a 1m07.894s. Bottas is being told to carve through the traffic in response.
2021-06-27T14:10:58Z: A lap later Leclerc gains another place, this time around the outside of Alonso at Turn 4, to move up to P8.
2021-06-27T14:10:02Z: But Leclerc isn't giving up, as he manages a switch pass, looking to the outside and then passing on the inside at the exit of Turn 4, to take ninth place from Tsunoda.
2021-06-27T14:10:40Z: Sainz has got the gap to Norris down to about eight seconds now, with 14 laps left on the board.
2021-06-27T14:08:13Z: Leclerc looks to pull off the same move around the outside at Turn 4 on Tsunoda but this time he locks up under braking and fails to get by the AlphaTauri driver for ninth.
2021-06-27T14:09:22Z: Perez, meanwhile, conducts a second stop for the medium tyre - given he's well ahead of Norris in fifth.
2021-06-27T14:08:45Z: Hamilton reports blistering on his right front tyre, as it seems the one-stop might be on a bit of a knife-edge.
2021-06-27T14:05:43Z: Leclerc has also been pinged for going over track limits at Turn 10 on a couple of occasions over the last handful of laps, so he'll need to be careful there for the rest of the race.
2021-06-27T14:03:35Z: Leclerc is certainly in a feisty mood today - he takes a look up the inside of Vettel at Turn 3, who locks up, and then gets the move done on the outside of Turn 4, as Vettel locks up again. The Ferrari driver is up to P10.
2021-06-27T14:04:28Z: Sainz is eating away at Norris now - the gap is 12s as it stands, but if Norris' tyres start to drop, Sainz's strategy would put him in contention for fifth.
2021-06-27T14:00:12Z: The other Ferrari driver, Leclerc, has moved ahead of both Alfa Romeos and is up to P11 having made his second pitstop of the afternoon - but did get a little too close for comfort against Raikkonen at Turn 3.
2021-06-27T13:57:21Z: Sainz, on fresh hards having just stopped, gets ahead of Stroll to regain sixth place. It is turning into a very strong race for the Spanish driver.
2021-06-27T13:56:26Z: Stroll's now under pressure from Sainz - who has jumped a fair few cars after going long.
2021-06-27T13:54:22Z: They must have heard us, as both Sainz and Ricciardo pit at the end of lap 42. Sainz comes back out in P7, ahead of Alonso and Tsunoda, with Ricciardo returning to the action in P15.
2021-06-27T13:54:20Z: Sainz finally pits from fifth, as does Ricciardo from seventh - both for the hard tyre.
2021-06-27T13:52:22Z: Sainz, in fifth, and Ricciardo, in seventh, are the last drivers standing in terms of pitstop strategies. They will be the ones to watch towards the end of this race.
2021-06-27T13:53:21Z: The front two now come up to traffic, and will be among a train of cars shortly.
2021-06-27T13:51:56Z: Bottas has duly picked up the pace relative to Perez, so perhaps a notification pinged up on his wheel to go faster.
2021-06-27T13:51:08Z: The AWS Overtake-o-meter predicts Perez getting to within striking distance of Bottas in about five laps - but it won't be necessarily easy.
2021-06-27T13:49:34Z: Russell's day is sadly over as he retires from the race and is pushed into the Williams garage.
2021-06-27T13:48:01Z: Alfa Romeo duly pit Raikkonen on lap 37, with Ricciardo staying out after initially being called in by his McLaren team.
2021-06-27T13:46:27Z: Raikkonen, up to P7 and yet to pit having started on the hards, is doing well to keep Ricciardo behind him who is on mediums but also yet to stop. Leclerc, still on his recovery drive, is tucked up behind both.
2021-06-27T13:44:08Z: Verstappen's a bit worried about his brake-by-wire - and Hamilton's reporting a lot of derating from his ERS. The front two aren't having an easy afternoon.
2021-06-27T13:42:42Z: Norris comes into do his stop, having dragged those softs to lap 32 - but now grabs the hard compound too.
2021-06-27T13:41:59Z: Hamilton and Verstappen now begin to trade fastest laps having collected fresh boots. Hamilton grabbed it at the end of lap 30, but it's Verstappen's once more.
2021-06-27T13:40:06Z: With Alonso and Tsunoda also pitting it has pushed Sainz up to sixth but the Ferrari driver, on mediums, is yet to stop in this race.
2021-06-27T13:39:54Z: Stroll peels into the pits for his stop, taking the hard tyre - as Verstappen now pits for the hard compound tyre too to retain the lead.
2021-06-27T13:38:02Z: More bad news for Russell, as he needs to pit again after that first stop and drops even more time -it looks like his hopes for points are over for another race.
2021-06-27T13:38:48Z: Hamilton also comes in, also for the hard tyre with a swift stop to put pressure on Verstappen.
2021-06-27T13:38:08Z: Bottas also comes in for a pitstop, also for the hard tyre - and gets the jump on Perez.
2021-06-27T13:36:14Z: Williams reports it is managing a power unit issue with Russell's car so that will explain his long pitstop. The British driver is back out in P17.
2021-06-27T13:36:51Z: Perez comes in to stop, but it's a rather slow one! The hard tyre goes onto that Red Bull.
2021-06-27T13:34:53Z: Russell's Plan B sees him pit on lap 27 and it is a very long stop - 18.3 seconds - as the Williams mechanics complete work on the sidepod of his car.
2021-06-27T13:35:28Z: Hamilton very nearly lost it at Turn 4! He held onto it well, but that could have been the end - the rear squirrelled out of step onto the gravel to give him a bit of a fright!
2021-06-27T13:33:26Z: Super move by Leclerc on Ocon around the outside at Turn 4 to take P14 on lap 24. Leclerc, on the hards, is making good work of picking through the lower order so far.

2021-06-27T13:30:01Z: Verstappen now drops a 1m09.585s to extend his advantage over Hamilton.

2021-06-27T13:07:46Z: Latifi also appeared to get caught up in the secondary clash at Turn 3 between Gasly and Giovinazzi, and the incidents have littered debris across that part of the track. Latifi is down in P19 having also pitted.
